subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The Railway Bubble: Victorian England's Tech Crash
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Railway Bubble: Victorian England's Tech Crash.

hook.text: In the 1840s, Britain invested a third of GDP in railways. Many routes went nowhere.

buildup.text: Railways were the internet of the 1840s. Everyone believed they would transform everything â€” and invested accordingly.

discovery.text: Parliament approved 272 railway acts in 1846 alone.

twist.text: When profits didn't materialize, shares crashed. But the tracks remained.

climax.text: Bubble investors lose money, but society often keeps the infrastructure.

punchline.text: Bubbles destroy investors but sometimes build civilization.

quiz.question: What lasting benefit came from the Victorian railway bubble?
options: Britain gained an extensive rail network even though investors lost fortunes
